item.title: CMD Runescape Private server error help please!
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

kk.

and yes,
port:43594

You need to port forward, hopefully you’ve done that already, then go to no-ip.com, register, go through all that and get a No-ip, then where it says “0.0.0.0” in your client/server files you need to change that to your no-ip.

good luck!

item.title: CMD Runescape Private server error help please!
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

You should have a Compile and something along the lines of “Run”

Two .batch files… I dunno why they would be separated, unless to simply make things more difficult.

if you feel like uploading, do so, and pm me the link. I’ll download your files and see whats going on, and if i can’t fix them for you.

Thanks

Read full topic
item.source: CMD Runescape Private server error help please!

item.title: CMD Runescape Private server error help please!
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

are you sure this is for the server, and not the client?

I’m pretty sure, because of the fact that the batch file says “Client Loading” that this is for a client,
In which case, your batch file cannot find your main class, meaning it can’t run what it’s set up to run…

The most common reason for this would be your batch file to be separated from your client files…

I’m guessing your directory looks like:

./Dir/(.batch file)/(client files)

If you understand what i mean, and i’m correct, simply move your .batch file into your client files:
./Dir/(client files+.batch file)

That’s the simplest way i can explain… sorry if it doesn’t help, but hopefully it did.

Read full topic
